exam.summary: Internal sensors detect an unauthorized life-form moving toward Main Engineering.

answers.text: Seal all affected decks, dispatch two containment teams, and coordinate with internal sensors for live tracking.
answers.details: Combines caution, coordination, and minimal risk to crew or ship systems.

answers.text: Send a single armed officer to intercept immediately.
answers.details: Overconfident approach that risks injury and loss of containment.

answers.text: Lock down Engineering only and await further movement before acting.
answers.details: Containment-oriented but reactive; loses initiative if intruder redirects.

exam.summary: A phaser goes off in a crowded corridor, injuring a civilian technician.

answers.text: Secure the weapon, assist medical personnel, and initiate a full forensic scan of the emitter.
answers.details: Follows Starfleet investigative sequence while prioritizing safety.

answers.text: Question nearby witnesses immediately before medical aid arrives.
answers.details: Neglects primary duty to preserve life and scene safety.

answers.text: Evacuate civilians, seal the area, and delegate evidence collection to forensics.
answers.details: Procedurally sound but delays immediate aid and identification of the shooter.

exam.summary: Scans reveal a container emitting faint tritanium resonance not listed on the manifest.

answers.text: Move the cargo to a secure bay, maintain environmental isolation, and perform a controlled scan.
answers.details: Standard Starfleet hazardous-material containment protocol.

answers.text: Open the container carefully to identify contents firsthand.
answers.details: Bypasses containment procedure and endangers the inspection team.

answers.text: Request engineering to remotely analyze the container’s molecular composition.
answers.details: Technically safe but delays action if the material is volatile.

exam.summary: Two officers escalate a personal dispute to physical aggression in a public area.

answers.text: Separate the individuals, remove them from duty, and file an immediate incident report.
answers.details: Restores order swiftly and preserves the integrity of the chain of command.

answers.text: Issue verbal warnings and order both officers back to their stations.
answers.details: Quick resolution but lacks disciplinary follow-through; may invite repetition.

answers.text: Allow the argument to finish to identify the aggressor.
answers.details: Unacceptable lapse in containment; jeopardizes bystanders.

exam.summary: A computer lockdown bypasses your access codes across all decks.

answers.text: Initiate a manual isolation of security nodes and coordinate with engineering to trace the breach.
answers.details: Integrates multidisciplinary response while maintaining compartmental integrity.

answers.text: Force a reboot of shipwide computer functions to restore control.
answers.details: Potentially restores access but disrupts all ship systems mid-operation.

answers.text: Abandon computer systems and focus on physical patrols instead.
answers.details: Ignores digital threat source and compromises monitoring capacity.

exam.summary: An intruder traps civilians in a shuttle bay, demanding transport off the ship.

answers.text: Establish communication, stall for time, and assemble a tactical team with full containment fields.
answers.details: Prioritizes negotiation and minimizes casualties consistent with Federation law enforcement doctrine.

answers.text: Authorize a precision phaser strike to eliminate the threat immediately.
answers.details: Premature use of lethal force; violates Starfleet Rules of Engagement.

answers.text: Cut power to the shuttle bay and attempt an environmental knockout via anesthetic gas.
answers.details: Viable non-lethal option though risky for hostages with medical vulnerabilities.

exam.summary: Critical systems fail after maintenance by a newly transferred crew member.

answers.text: Secure the officer, restrict access privileges, and conduct a technical audit of recent work logs.
answers.details: Balanced response preserving security and due process.

answers.text: Accuse the officer publicly to deter further sabotage.
answers.details: Destroys morale and violates investigative confidentiality.

answers.text: Increase security monitoring silently while gathering additional evidence.
answers.details: Cautious and professional though slower to contain risk if sabotage is ongoing.

exam.summary: Unknown vessels engage tractor beams and begin transporting boarding parties.

answers.text: Raise shields, jam transport signatures, and coordinate with tactical for counter-transport protocols.
answers.details: Demonstrates readiness and multi-system defense coordination.

answers.text: Target the attacking ships’ engines immediately to disable them.
answers.details: Aggressive yet defensible; risk of escalation remains high.

answers.text: Evacuate lower decks and seal off the rest of the ship manually.
answers.details: Overly reactive; sacrifices control of strategic sections unnecessarily.
